VIII.iv.1.A.3.j
.
Establishing a Stressor Related to Combat
Concede a stressor when
a Veteran received one of the combat decorations cited in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.A.3.h
, or
there is other credible supporting evidence that the Veteran engaged in combat as defined in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.A.3.e
.
Note
:  If the Veteran does not expressly state the nature of the stressor,
assume the stressor is combat-related if the Veteran received one of the combat decorations cited in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.A.3.h
, and
request service personnel records as discussed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.A.2.e
.
References
:  For more information on
determining combat service, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.D.2.b and c
guidance not to exclude a claim for PTSD from the Fully Developed Claim Program due to non-receipt of
VA Form 21-0781
when a Veteran is in receipt of a recognized combat decoration, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 2.B.2.a
, and
when to proceed with an examination in a PTSD claim, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.C
.
